text: Role of cellular tumor necrosis factor receptor - associated factors in NF-kappaB activation and lymphocyte transformation by herpesvirus Saimiri STP .

The STP oncoproteins of the herpesvirus saimiri ( HVS ) subgroup A strain 11 and subgroup C strain 488 are now found to be stably associated with <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor receptor-associated factor (TRAF) 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , or <extra_id_0> 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Mutational analyses identified residues of PXQXT / S in <extra_id_0> STP-A11 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as critical for TRAF association .
In addition , a somewhat divergent region of <extra_id_0> STP-C488 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is critical for TRAF association .
Mutational analysis also revealed that <extra_id_0> STP-C488 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced NF-kappaB activation that was correlated with its ability to associate with TRAFs .

The HVS <extra_id_0> STP-C488 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> P10 -- > R mutant was deficient in human T-lymphocyte transformation to <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - independent growth but showed wild-type phenotype for marmoset T-lymphocyte transformation in vitro and in vivo .

The <extra_id_0> STP-C488 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> P10 -- > R mutant was also defective in Rat-1 fibroblast transformation , and fibroblast cell transformation was blocked by a <extra_id_0> TRAF2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> dominant - negative mutant .
These data implicate TRAFs in <extra_id_0> STP-C488 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated transformation of human lymphocytes and rodent fibroblasts .
Other factors are implicated in immortalization of common marmoset T lymphocytes and may also be critical in the transformation of human lymphocytes and rodent fibroblasts .
